Global objectives: To contribute to the improvement of EU-funded assistance to the Republic of Belarus.

Specific objectives: To help the Delegation of the EU to the Republic of Belarus and its headquarters fine tune future assistance, implementation and coordination mechanisms of assistance provided to Belarus from 2016 onwards.

Location visits: Brussels, Brest (Belarus), Hrodna, Minsk, Rostock, Hamburg, Wismar, Vilnius, Biała Podlaska, Warsaw and home office.

Evaluator / Senior Expert

Qualifications and skills:

Education: at least master degree (academic level);

Or, in the absence of a university degree, minimum of three additional years of professional experience on top of the ten years mentioned under general professional experience (see next criteria).

General professional experience:

Minimum of ten years of professional experience in the sector of development policies.

Specific professional experience:

  • Having carried out a minimum of two mid-term/final and/or sector evaluations;
  • Experience in Result-Oriented Monitoring exercises would be an asset;
  • Experience in designing EU-funded assistance programmes would be an asset (drafting of Terms of Reference, Action Fiches/Documents, etc.);
  • Experience in a country of the former Soviet Union5 would be an asset;
  • Experience in working in, or on, a CBC programme/project would be an asset.

Language skills:

  • Fluency in spoken and written English;
  • Knowledge of Russian and/or Belarusian and/or Polish

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
